lines.text: Indian's don't last in prison. They weren't born for it like the whites.

In the summer of 1909, a member of the oldest American minority, a Paiute Indian named Willie Boy, became the center of an extraordinary historical event. This is what happened in the deserts of California.
[first lines]
Did you see that crazy Calvert go by?
Ate his dust.
When did you get back to Banning, Willie Boy?
Five o'clock freight.
Goin' to the fiesta?
Is that where you're goin', Tom?
Trailin' Mr. Calvert with a tow just in case he breaks down - or breaks his neck.
Well, I guess that's where I'm goin'.
Mr. Calvert said you been a foreman on a ranch in Victorville for a while.
Yep.
I hear a white woman owned it.
You heard right.
And you left?
Husband come home.
Why do you want trouble?
It goes with you.
I'm not worth it.
You bet.
Here comes your trouble - my father and my brothers.
I told you before - I'll shoot you. Don't you believe me, Willie Boy?
I believe you, Mike. Last time I run off with it. This time I'm askin' you.
I can't hear you.
Well, you'd better.
Whatcha got, Meathead? Death Valley Juice?
Hell, no - white man's whiskey. I got real confidence in it. I didn't make it - I stole it. Buyin'?
I'm waitin'. See how long it takes to kill.

That's the way to be born if you gotta be born, Coop. Boston money, smart and snotty, everything comin' to you. The superintendent of this here Indian reservation has got the finest legs I've ever seen on man or beast. It's too bad she don't like you, Coop. There's gold in them hills.
Any of you boys ridin' up to Riverside for the parade?
I wouldn't budge my butt to see President Taft. Why should I?
The President's gonna feel pretty bad about that, Hack.
Out! I'm not about to waste my night in jail with you. Get your rig and get the hell out of the county.
That's damn white of you, Sheriff.
That damned redskin tried to kill me! What kind of town is this? That's my blood. He tried to kill me!
If he tried, you'd be dead.
I use you the way you use me and if you weren't a fool playing sheriff in a dusty market town you'd know that. You'd know something!
Who do you think you are?
Elizabeth Arnold - A.B., Radcliffe; Anthropologist, Smithsonian; M.D., Johns Hopkins! Who are you?
Frank, I need a coroner down here right away.
Who got killed?
Some Indian. The killer's run away with his daughter.
Willie killed Mike and took Lola. They call it marriage by capture. The mother knew that and told her to go.
Don't feel sad. I didn't hate him. One way of the other you die in the end. They won't catch us, Lola. They won't even try. Nobody gives a damn what Indians do. Nobody.

What the hell's he want to go go to Palm Springs for? What's he got there but some lungers livin' in tents and some Indians he don't know. He should be headin' to Twenty-Nine Palms where he can get help. He should be headed up the Dry Morengo Pass.
I didn't think they'd want me that bad. Maybe they're like me. Maybe it's you they want.
What's he doin' along if he don't want to catch him?

Willie didn't even have a gun when he went for that girl of his and I don't want to see him lynched by some poolroom bum or some politician like you - and I'm tellin' you whether you like it or not, Judge.
I think you send that man home, Sheriff.
You're not mayor yet, Judge. You're just runnin' - the same as Willie.
Willie, are you going to kill them?
If I have to.
What do you mean, "If you have to?"
I mean if they keep comin'.
But they're white, Willie. They'll shoot forever.
How long is that? Less than you think.
It's crazy, Willie! You can't win. You can't beat them, Willie, ever.
Maybe... maybe. But they'll know I was here.
It's Charlie Newcomb.
Maybe they put a few dollars on my head and he needs a new guitar.

What I'm tryin' to say is that federal agents were watchin' when McKinley was gunned down in Buffalo by a lone assassin. Anybody can kill the President if they want to. They don't even need a good reason. They don't even need to be smart. All they need to be is willing. Now people back East don't understand guns, but nobody believes that. Out West, we've learned to live with 'em. Presidential assasination will not happen in this town like it happened to President McKinley.
Would you boys like to see the Presidential suite?
I think the gentlemen would like to see the bar. The orange juice is on the house; the bourbon is on Sheriff Wilson.
I've never seen you in Eastern war paint before.
I need their help with the President. They're more likely to help their own kind.
Well, you're their kind.
I just want to be the first to print the news.
Even if there is none.
Bad news, Coop, real bad!
Like what?
Willie Boy and a band of Paiutes ambushed the posse.
How do you know?
What do you mean, "How do I know?" It's on the Western Union from Whitewater Station.
How many got it?

Ray Calvert's dead. Two or three others - we don't know. Those newshounds are burning up the wires and they're pulling you and me right in the middle along side of the President. And those sons-of-bitches are in there gettin' half drunk on my whiskey!

Is there any danger to Riverside? What about the President's train? How could a couple of hundred Indians get the idea they could overthrow the government of the United States? And where is Ruby Mountain?
Where it always has been.
You keep pushin' him and he's gonna start killin' for real and all this bull they're makin' up is going to come true.
My father got it from a horse thief in a Ludlow saloon that was so drunk he couldn't even stand up.
Indian wasn't it?
Half and half.
Well, it don't make sense.
Maybe that's the sense it makes.
Run! Run! The road leads right to them. Tell them Willie Boy is here!
Same signal for you.
Suppose you get a knife in your gut so I don't hear no shots at all?
You'll hear me grunt.
She sure don't look dead.
She will soon.
[last lines]
We've got nothing to show. What the hell's the matter with you? Goddammit, Coop, people have got to see something!
Tell 'em we're all out of souvenirs.
